name: Lockstep (Zombrodo)
description:
How to Play:

W, A, S, D - Movement

You can only move your character when the Clock is on your Colour (Blue)

Left-Click - Attack

The aim of the game is to survive as long as possible without you yourself being slapped!

The theme of the Jam was 'Frequency' so I went with the concept of a CPU clock. CPU's operate in cycles, hence the 'clock'. In the game, you can only execute the instructions for your little toon when the clock is over your colour - somehow tying back to a clock? Loose I know, but I wanted to opt for something that wasn't music or sound related, which were the first things that came to mind when thinking of frequencies.

Extra Comments:

This is actually my first fully 'complete' game - never made music, never made art, never dealt with multiple states, never actually finished something! Thanks +7, and the LÖVE community for all your help!

Pre-apology for any bugs found! Known bugs include collisions aren't pixel perfect and that sometimes little toons appear outside of the arena.

 If you ever dare delve into the `.love` folder, I apologise, normally my code isn't so spaget!

I would love to come back to this idea in the future, so many corners cut, and so many unexplored avenues - so watch this space
